result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS:  SWH.  Probation for 2 years.  CONDITIONS:  Counseling deemed appropriate by agent, get children to school unless there is a valid dr's excuse, GFE at FTE/Schooling or combo, ltr of apology to Walmart, CC w/DNA surcharge.  No credit if revoked.

Adj:  3:56 pm
Plea hearing on March 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Case called: 8:39am. Clerk: INCLUDES 14CM2311 (BFH), 15CM256, 15CM260 (TRACKING)Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears by and with Atty Julie Sawyer. Atty Sawyer states Atty Ryan Lister is present and may have better information as she was just appointed on 2/13/15. Atty Sawyer makes argument; moves to Withdraw Speedy Trial Demand and moves to not forfeit bond.  Arguments by State. Crt does not forfeit bond at this time. Crt accepts Withdrawal of Speedy Trial Demand. FPT & JT removed on all files. DATES: PTC 3/9/15 @ 2:20pm. Adjourned: 8:44am.

INCLUDES 15CM256 and 15CM260.  No contact with victim(s):  Walmart.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
